page.title: 06Transport around Fearn.
page.content: Around Fearn there are not many ways to travel.One and a half miles away is Fearn Station.It is an old station and now there aren't any staff, it is a request stop.The trains pass en route for Thurso and Inverness.South connections are made at Inverness and a change at Dingwall means you can go west.The fare to Tain is 20 pence which is a lot less than by taxi or bus.The bus service is popular as it goes through the village and there are several daily services.The fare to Tain has recently gone up 2p.to 38p..A bus at 8.30am.takes school children to Tain Royal Academy. Most people own cars as this is a much easier means of getting around.Most roads are either B class or single track.All have a tarred surface.
